licence_overview:
$!Contact the Architects Registration Board to register as an architect working in the UK.$!

##Restrictions

You can register if you have:

- UK professional qualifications
- EU professional qualifications

^If you have qualifications from overseas including some EU and other [non-recognised qualifications](http://www.arb.org.uk/registration/how_to_register/overseas_and_non-recognised_uk_qualifications.php "Non-recognised architect qualifications"){:rel="external"} you must pass the Architects Registration Board's own exam before registering.^

###Temporary register

If you'll only be working as an architect on a temporary or occasional basis, you can apply to join the temporary register.

You'll need to show proof that:

- you're an European Economic Area (EEA) national
- you're lawfully set up to practice in another European member state
- you hold professional qualifications
- you have 2 years' professional experience in another EEA member state

###How to register

To register online, visit the Architects Registration Board [online application portal](https://applicants.arb.org.uk/Login.aspx?status=n&formtype=uk “ Architects Registration Board application portal”){:rel="external"}.

If you have queries about registering, contact the Architects Registration Board.

$C 
**Architects Registration Board**  
<info@arb.org.uk>  
020 7580 5861  $C

##Fines & penalties

You could be fined up to £2,500 per offence for using the name 'architect' without being registered.  This includes using the letters of the professional bodies, eg RIBA or RIAS after your name.

*[EEA]: European Economic Area
licence_short_description: Register as an architect with the Architects Registration Board before working as an architect in the UK.
overview: Register with the Architects Registration Board before working as an architect in the UK - temporary register, fines, penalties, qualifications
title: Register as an architect
